intro: Lagoseris bifida, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows from a short, woody caudex and has a low, sprawling growth habit. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often greenish or reddish in color, and it produces small, dry fruits. Lagoseris bifida is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
